com.powerup.logic

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.powerup.logic.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Player>

    public class Player
extends Object
implements Comparable<Player>
    A player of the game. Has cash and can use it to buy shares.
    Since:
    2014-01-22
    Author:
    Oliver Lewisohn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Creates a new player with $5000 and space for five tiles.

        public String toString()
        Overrides:

      • addTileToHand

        public boolean addTileToHand(Tile tile)
        Adds a specified tile to the player's hand, providing there is room.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to be added.
        Returns:
        True if there was room for the tile, otherwise false.

      • returnTileFromHand

        public Tile returnTileFromHand(int n)
        Takes a tile from the player's hand and returns it.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of the tile to be taken, from 0 to 4.
        Returns:
        The tile which has been taken.

      • getNumberOfShares

        public int getNumberOfShares(Company company)
        Finds out how many shares the player owns in a given company.
        Parameters:
        company - The company to be checked.
        Returns:
        The number of shares the player owns in the given company.

      • buyShare

        public boolean buyShare(Company company,
               boolean freebie)
        Instructs the player to buy a share in the given company.
        Parameters:
        company - The company to buy a share from.
        freebie - Whether or not the player has to pay for buying the share. When creating a company, the first share is free.
        Returns:
        Whether or not a share could be bought with the player's current cash.

      • getCash

        public int getCash()

      • setCash

        public void setCash(int cash)

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int n)
        Fetches a tile from the player's hand without removing it.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of the tile to be fetched, from 0 to 4.
        Returns:
        The desired tile (can be null).

      • getTiles

        public Tile[] getTiles()

        Finds out how many tiles a player currently has in their hand.
        Returns:
        The size of the player's hand.

      • sellShares

        public int sellShares(Company prey)
        Instructs the player to sell all their shares in a given company.
        Parameters:
        prey - The company (being taken over) whose shares should be sold.
        Returns:
        The cash generated through the sale.
